name: Smallest number k that is powerful but not a prime power that is also coprime to n.
comment: Let p be the smallest prime that is coprime to n and let q be the second smallest prime that is coprime to n. Then a(n) = p^2 * q^2.
Records in this sequence are set by n in A002110.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: For k and m such that rad(k) = rad(m), a(k) = a(m), where rad = A007947.
example: a(12) = 1225 = (5*7)^2, since p = 5, q = 7, a(k) = 1225 for n in A033845 (i.e., n such that rad(n) = 6), where rad = A007947.
a(20) = 441 = (3*7)^2, since p = 3, q = 7, a(k) = 441 for n in A033846 (i.e., n such that rad(n) = 10).
mathematica: Table[c = 0; q = 2; Times @@ Reap[While[c < 2, While[Divisible[n, q], q = NextPrime[q]]; Sow[q^2]; q = NextPrime[q]; c++] ][[-1, 1]], {n, 120}]
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 04 2025
